name: Breakfast Blueberry Cheesecake Muffins
author: Cheerios
summary: A very light cheesecake muffin with juicy blueberries that give the muffins a nice fruity flavor for breakfast or brunch.
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners
Stir flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl; set aside
Beat eggs with an electric mixer in a bowl on medium speed until light and frothy
Beat cream cheese in a large bowl with an electric mixer until fluffy
Add sugar and mix to form a smooth paste
Add beaten eggs and beat with an electric mixer until a smooth creamy batter forms, 4 to 5 minutes
Fold cream and blueberries into the batter and mix until just combined
Add flour mixture and fold in just until absorbed
Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed and muffins are lightly browned, about 20 minutes
Cool in the tin for 5 minutes
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely
